Initial Site Design

Feb 4, 2015 in site

#css • #scss • #markdown •

Just put some finishing touches on the design of the site. I was inspired by the color themes on http://git-scm.com/

The Home, About and Resume sections are now up.

Projects section

I intend to try to hook up my projects this week (probably will utilize iframes calling from Gists and Github, or explore some Jekyll options to integrate open-source projects into the home page.

Blog section

I have some ideas on designing the Blog section: - Lay out categories and tags in an <aside> where we can filter blog posts by categories or tags. - Figure out what the categories are going to be. Some rough categories would be: data, visualization, site, Python, R, to help users find interesting posts. - Explore hooking up a third-party chat/comment system, probably Disqus?

A note on markdown

And I'm starting to fall in love with markdown. I think there's already been a rising adoption of using markdowns in many forums and chatting functionality. Here's hoping that this awesome writing language for the web continues a positive adoption trend!
